Datetime.description:
Timestamp in [ISO 8601](#https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) format
with a few restrictions listed [here](https://docs.python.org/3/library/datetime.html#datetime.datetime.fromisoformat).
Datetime.title: Datetime

FixedZeroMeanUnitVarianceAlongAxisKwargs.description:
Normalize with fixed, precomputed values for mean and variance.
See `zero_mean_unit_variance` for data dependent normalization.
FixedZeroMeanUnitVarianceAlongAxisKwargs.title: FixedZeroMeanUnitVarianceAlongAxisKwargs

FixedZeroMeanUnitVarianceDescr.description: Subtract a given mean and divide by a given variance.
FixedZeroMeanUnitVarianceDescr.title: FixedZeroMeanUnitVarianceDescr

FixedZeroMeanUnitVarianceKwargs.description:
Normalize with fixed, precomputed values for mean and variance.
See `zero_mean_unit_variance` for data dependent normalization.
FixedZeroMeanUnitVarianceKwargs.title: FixedZeroMeanUnitVarianceKwargs

ImplicitOutputShape.description:
Output tensor shape depending on an input tensor shape.
`shape(output_tensor) = shape(input_tensor) * scale + 2 * offset`
ImplicitOutputShape.title: ImplicitOutputShape

ParameterizedInputShape.description: A sequence of valid shapes given by `shape_k = min + k * step for k in {0, 1, ...}`.
ParameterizedInputShape.title: ParameterizedInputShape

ParameterizedSize.description: Describes a range of valid tensor axis sizes as `size = min + n*step`.
ParameterizedSize.title: ParameterizedSize

SizeReference.description:
A tensor axis size (extent in pixels/frames) defined in relation to a reference axis.

`axis.size = reference.size * reference.scale / axis.scale + offset`

note:
1. The axis and the referenced axis need to have the same unit (or no unit).
2. Batch axes may not be referenced.
3. Fractions are rounded down.
4. If the reference axis is `concatenable` the referencing axis is assumed to be
    `concatenable` as well with the same block order.

example:
An unisotropic input image of w*h=100*49 pixels depicts a phsical space of 200*196mm².
Let's assume that we want to express the image height h in relation to its width w
instead of only accepting input images of exactly 100*49 pixels
(for example to express a range of valid image shapes by parametrizing w, see `ParameterizedSize`).

>>> w = SpaceInputAxis(id=AxisId("w"), size=100, unit="millimeter", scale=2)
>>> h = SpaceInputAxis(
...     id=AxisId("h"),
...     size=SizeReference(tensor_id=TensorId("input"), axis_id=AxisId("w"), offset=-1),
...     unit="millimeter",
...     scale=4,
... )
>>> print(h.size.compute(h, w))
49

-> h = w * w.scale / h.scale + offset = 100 * 2mm / 4mm - 1 = 49
SizeReference.title: SizeReference

Version.description: wraps a packaging.version.Version instance for validation in pydantic models
Version.title: Version

covers.description:
Cover images. Please use an image smaller than 500KB and an aspect ratio width to height of 2:1.
The supported image formats are: ('.gif', '.jpeg', '.jpg', '.png', '.svg', '.tif', '.tiff')

The supported image formats are: ('.gif', '.jpeg', '.jpg', '.png', '.svg')
covers.title: Covers

source.description: URL or path to the source of the application
source.title: Source

bioimageio__spec__collection__v0_2__Coll.description:
A bioimage.io collection describes several other bioimage.io resources.
Note that collections cannot be nested; resources listed under `collection` may not be collections themselves.

covers.description:
Cover images. Please use an image smaller than 500KB and an aspect ratio width to height of 2:1.
The supported image formats are: ('.gif', '.jpeg', '.jpg', '.png', '.svg', '.tif', '.tiff')
covers.title: Covers

bioimageio__spec__collection__v0_2__Coll.title: bioimage.io collection specification

bioimageio__spec__collection__v0_2__Coll.description:
A valid resource description (RD).
The entry RD is based on the collection description itself.
Fields are added/overwritten by the content of `rdf_source` if `rdf_source` is specified,
and finally added/overwritten by any fields specified directly in the entry.
Except for the `id` field, fields are overwritten entirely, their content is not merged!
The final `id` for each collection entry is composed of the collection's `id`
and the entry's 'sub-'`id`, specified remotely as part of `rdf_source` or superseeded in-place,
such that the `final_entry_id = <collection_id>/<entry_id>`
bioimageio__spec__collection__v0_2__Coll.title: CollectionEntry

bioimageio__spec__collection__v0_3__Coll.description:
A bioimage.io collection resource description file (collection RDF) describes a collection of bioimage.io
resources.
The resources listed in a collection RDF have types other than 'collection'; collections cannot be nested.

covers.description:
Cover images. Please use an image smaller than 500KB and an aspect ratio width to height of 2:1 or 1:1.
The supported image formats are: ('.gif', '.jpeg', '.jpg', '.png', '.svg')
covers.title: Covers

bioimageio__spec__collection__v0_3__Coll.title: bioimage.io collection specification

bioimageio__spec__collection__v0_3__Coll.description:
A collection entry description is based on the collection description itself.
Fields are added/overwritten by the content of `descr_source` if `descr_source` is set,
and finally added/overwritten by any fields specified directly in the entry.
Except for the `id` field, fields are overwritten entirely, their content is not merged!
The final `id` for each collection entry is composed of the collection's `id`
and the entry's 'sub-'`id`, specified externally in `descr_source` or superseeded in-place,
such that the `final_entry_id = <collection_id>/<entry_id>`
bioimageio__spec__collection__v0_3__Coll.title: CollectionEntry

BinarizeDescr the tensor with a fixed threshold.
Values above the threshold will be set to one, values below the threshold to zero.

bioimageio__spec__model__v0_4__ModelDesc.description:
Specification of the fields used in a bioimage.io-compliant RDF that describes AI models with pretrained weights.

These fields are typically stored in a YAML file which we call a model resource description file (model RDF).

The supported image formats are: ('.gif', '.jpeg', '.jpg', '.png', '.svg', '.tif', '.tiff')

architecture_sha256.description:
The SHA256 of the architecture source file, if the architecture is not defined in a module listed in `dependencies`
You can drag and drop your file to this
[online tool](http://emn178.github.io/online-tools/sha256_checksum.html) to generate a SHA256 in your browser.
Or you can generate a SHA256 checksum with Python's `hashlib`,
[here is a codesnippet](https://gist.github.com/FynnBe/e64460463df89439cff218bbf59c1100).
architecture_sha256.title: Architecture Sha256

bioimageio__spec__model__v0_5__ScaleMean.description:
Scale a tensor's data distribution to match another tensor's mean/std.
`out  = (tensor - mean) / (std + eps) * (ref_std + eps) + ref_mean.`
bioimageio__spec__model__v0_5__ScaleMean.title: ScaleMeanVarianceKwargs
